discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
it should be e5

A is correct. - We need 'Phone System'.

https://teams-phone.com/microsoft-365-licenses-required-for-telephony-on-microsoft-teams
 > Office 365 E5 and Microsoft 365 E5 subscriptions include the Phone System and Audio-conferencing add-ons which allow you to switch to telephony at no additional cost.
 > Office 365 E1, Office 365 E3 and Microsoft 365 E3 subscriptions require at least the Phone System add-on to use telephony on Teams.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

comments.content: Microsoft 365 E3 does not include the Phone System license, you need it as an addon.

discussion.content:
he answer is C. Microsoft 365 E3 or Microsoft 365 E5.

Here's a breakdown of why these licenses are required for PSTN calling with an SBC:

PSTN Calling Capabilities: Both Microsoft 365 E3 and E5 include the Phone System add-on, which provides the essential features for making and receiving calls to and from the public switched telephone network (PSTN).
SBC Integration: These licenses also support the integration of a Session Border Controller (SBC), a crucial device that manages calls between Teams and the PSTN, ensuring security and interoperability.
Other Licenses Lack Phone System: While Office 365 E3 and E5 may include some communication features, they don't provide the full Phone System capabilities required for PSTN calling with an SBC.
La respuesta es la "A", solos las licencias de Office 365 E5 y M 365 E5 incluyen el addon de Phone System Standard

Selected Answer: A
As per: https://www.call2teams.com/blog/microsoft-teams-phone-licensing-explained/

comments.content: the e3 does not include the phone system license, which is needed, so C is wrong

discussion.content: C. Microsoft 365 E3 or Microsoft 365 E5

Selected Answer: A
E5 in my opinion

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your company has a Microsoft Teams deployment.

You have two users that have event group responsibilities as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


The company plans to run a live event for an upcoming product meeting.

Which role should you assign to User1 and User2 to manage the live event? To answer, drag the appropriate roles to the correct users. Each role may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.C: From Meeting policies, modify Media bit rate (KBs).
choices.A: Configure a video distribution provider eCDN.

discussion.content:
The best solution to minimize the impact of live events on the internet link of the remote office is:

A. Configure a video distribution provider eCDN (Enterprise Content Delivery Network)
A is correct. QoE is wrong since it can only be used inside the company network.

Selected Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ecdn/intro

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Microsoft Teams live events for online employee training sessions.

During the last live event, there were 100 attendees in a remote office. The attendees reported connectivity issues.

You discover that the internet connection at the remote office was saturated.

You need to minimize the impact of live events on the internet links of the remote office.

What should you do?

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.
You have a call queue named Customer Service.
You need to ensure that when the agents of Customer Service make calls, the outbound calling name appears as Contoso, and the caller ID shows the phone number of Customer Service. Other users must NOT be affected.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents a part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, configure a new caller ID policy.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the global (Org-wide default) caller ID policy.
choices.B: Set Calling Party Name to the organization name.
choices.D: Set Replace the caller ID with to Resource account.
choices.E: Set Override the caller ID policy to On.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
Yes, it should be ABD - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/caller-id-policies

Selected Answer: ADE
B referes to the organization's name which isn't the goal.
E - this ensure that the configured Caller ID Policy is enforced and applied to outbound calls from the Customer Service agent.

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD should be there. There is no ON switch to activate the policy.

Selected Answer: ABD
Agreed, it should be ABD.

Given answers are correct. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/caller-id-policies#create-a-custom-caller-id-policy
ABD are required.

Selected Answer: ABD
Agree with ABD.
Override the caller ID policy is not mandatory.
Shouldn't it be ABD?
